define-field.name: validate
define-field.description: Points to an abstract rule set, by means of a reference to a work in the manifest.

flag.name: rules
flag.description: Should resolve to a work elsewhere in the manifest, whereby technology-appropriate mappings may be made.

define-field.name: valid
define-field.description: In contrast to abstract validations, these are actual executable validation operations. As such, a validation may also imply or warrant further (processing) semantics. (tbd)

flag.name: timestamp
flag.description: When a validation is represented as having been performed. Should not be a date in the future.

define-flag.name: href
define-flag.description: A relative URI, resolved with reference to base (ancestry).

define-assembly.name: group
define-assembly.description: A group of resources, organized as works, each of which may have several representations or embodiments. Groups can appear within groups for categorization of their works. A group may be designated with its own retrieval path (absolute or relative to its containing group or registry), to be used as a basis for retrieval of items (works) from within the group.

flag.name: base
flag.description: Nominal reference URI from which relative URIs are determined. As a relative URI, this is resolved relative to any ancestor base flags, resolved with the base URI of the manifest itself as the ultimate base ".". Any base may be defined either relatively to bases above it, or as an absolute URI (URL) on the Internet.

define-assembly.name: work
define-assembly.description: An abstract resource, considered as a generalized "work" (FRBR). A work is capable of multiple different representations. A resource registry provides a mapping from works to expressions and instances of that work, represented as items.

flag.name: id
flag.description: A unique id or key for reference across the system of documents described by this manifest.

define-assembly.name: item
define-assembly.description: A particular instantiation or retrievable (actionable) representation of a work. The form the item takes is relative to the item.

flag.name: format
flag.description: The nominal format of the item.

define-assembly.name: mirror
define-assembly.description: A subgrouping of items found relative to a new base.

define-flag.name: base
define-flag.description: A definition or redefinition of a URI base from which file traversal is executed. As a relative URI, this should be resolved in relation to the actual calculated base of the context.
